item.title: Ticket #579 (Options saved as wp_specialchars) updated
item.dc:creator: ColdForged
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #579 (Options saved as wp_specialchars) created
item.dc:creator: ColdForged
item.description:
In wp-admin/options.php revision 1.38, the new value of an option is now sent through wp_specialchars() and saved in the database that way. When that option is thereafter echoed back into the form, it is sent through htmlspecialchars() which encodes any ampersands from the wp_specialchars.

Therefore, something like setting the "Prepend updated with:" option under Miscellaneous to be "<strong>" ends up being encoded into "&lt;strong&gt;" which means that updated links have the literal <strong>Link</strong> displayed on the links list instead of the HTML strong tag.

item.title: Ticket #578 (Links cannot be edited) updated
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description:
Reproducibility, Resolution, Severity changed

On a fresh install of 1.2.2, there is no problem editing links. Make sure that you use the wp-settings.php file from 1.2.2. Also, make a new wp-config.php file from wp-config-sample.php included w/ 1.2.2.

Tech note: The query fails because the var $tablelinks wasn't set, this is what holds the table name for the links table. The query as shown above is missing the table name. The $tablelinks var is assigned a value in the wp-settings.php file. Most likely, a file was corrupted, and the var wasn't set.

item.title: Ticket #578 (Links cannot be edited) updated
item.dc:creator: deadscan
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #578 (Links cannot be edited) created
item.dc:creator: deadscan
item.description:
Trying to edit a link, causes the following message:

Database error: [You have an error in your SQL syntax. Check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'WHERE link_id = 63' at line 1] SELECT * FROM WHERE link_id = 63 Link not found.

item.title: Ticket #300 (Blank settings when using ?showoptions=all get changed to "0") updated
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description:
Reminder sent to rboren

Check out my note above (0000962), this could nuke some "power user's" blog if the wrong fields are left blank.

item.title: Ticket #300 (Blank settings when using ?showoptions=all get changed to "0") updated
item.dc:creator: Kitten
item.description:
The new update schema sets "option_type int(11) NOT NULL default '1'" to all options. These lines from options.php cause the problem: if (!$new_val) {

if (3 == $option->option_type)

$new_val = ;

else

$new_val = 0;

}

Since all options are type 1 now, all blank options are set to 0. Not ideal, as you have noticed. The devs will have to discuss what to do, maybe the option types need to be set properly?

item.title: Ticket #488 (convert linebreaks breaks pre-tag formattting) updated
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description:
bugger, first I did'nt log in and then I mess up the tags once again...

look at ​http://wiki.wordpress.org/?pagename=autop-bugs for the solution.

edited on: 12-20-04 10:58

item.title: Ticket #488 (convert linebreaks breaks pre-tag formattting) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
These two lines added to wp-includes/functions-formatting.php seem to fix the problem:

function clean_pre($text) {

$text = str_replace('<br />', , $text);

+ $text = str_replace('<p>', "\n", $text); + $text = str_replace('</p>', , $text);

return $text;

}

item.dc:creator: morganiq
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #577 ('Users' link not highlighted on Users Admin page) created
item.dc:creator: morganiq

item.title: Ticket #576 (Error: please fill the required fields (name, email).) updated
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #576 (Error: please fill the required fields (name, email).) created
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description:
On Dec 16th a lot of lines have been deleted from wp-comments-post.php which results in the comment function being broken now.

line 25:

if ( get_settings('require_name_email') && ( == $email
== $author) )

should be

if ( get_settings('require_name_email') && ( == $comment_author_email
== $comment_author) )

otherwise this check always fails and commenting dies with "Error: please fill the required fields (name, email)."

item.title: Ticket #574 (clean_pre() doesn't clean paragraph tags from pre elements) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #574 (clean_pre() doesn't clean paragraph tags from pre elements) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #574 (clean_pre() doesn't clean paragraph tags from pre elements) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
in functions-formatting.php, clean_pre() is called by wpautop() for [pre](.*?)pre; sections, but while it does clean '[br /]' out, it fails to clean out [p] and p.

This leads to validation errors and unclosed [p] elements.

item.title: Ticket #573 (When adding a normal comment the 'comment_type' field should be set to ...) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #573 (When adding a normal comment the 'comment_type' field should be set to ...) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
At the moment, in comment_post.php (used for adding 'normal' comments, i.e. non trackback/pingback), the comment_type field is just set to a blank string:

$comment_type = ;

I propose we change this line to:

$comment_type = 'comment';

Any other description would be an improvement.
